qas.question: Inscriptions from what language were sometimes present on pub signs?
Along with The Star and The Sun, what was a typical symbol used on a pub sign?
What graphic belonging to the local lord was sometimes incorporated on the pub sign?
What plants were sometimes featured on pub signs?
Local pub nicknames were often related to what profession?

context: The earliest signs were often not painted but consisted, for example, of paraphernalia connected with the brewing process such as bunches of <a3_0>hops<a3_0/> or brewing implements, which were suspended above the door of the pub. In some cases local nicknames, <a4_0>farming<a4_0/> terms and puns were used. Local events were often commemorated in pub signs. Simple natural or religious symbols such as 'The Sun', 'The Star' and '<a1_0>The Cross<a1_0/>' were incorporated into pub signs, sometimes being adapted to incorporate elements of the heraldry (e.g. <a2_0>the coat of arms<a2_0/>) of the local lords who owned the lands upon which the pub stood. Some pubs have <a0_0>Latin<a0_0/> inscriptions.
